paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Val-20 to Ile, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: German family, index patient aged 60, sex not specified

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The index patient suffered from severe amyloid cardiomyopathy at the age of 60.
Two other family members were carriers but remained unaffected.
Two other family members were carriers but remained unaffected.

functional_data.summary: The Ile-20 monomer's conformational stability and unfolding behavior were almost indistinguishable from that of wild-type TTR, but tetramer stability was significantly reduced.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence for pathogenicity based on clinical presentation and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the impact of the Val-20 to Ile mutation on TTR stability and its association with amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The index patient suffered from severe amyloid cardiomyopathy at the age of 60.
Two other family members were carriers but remained unaffected.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
